</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(11)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Stockholders' Equity and Stock-based Compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Stock Option Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has adopted stock option plans for eligible employees, directors and consultants, which provide for the granting of options to purchase shares of common stock. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	847,635
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;outstanding options under the Company&#8217;s stock option plans, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	599,720
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares available for future grant and issuance. The option and share numbers have been retroactively adjusted to reflect the one-for-fifteen reverse stock split completed on February 4, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The options under these plans generally vest in equal annual installments over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year period and have a term of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years. These options are typically granted with an exercise price per share equal to or greater than the current market price and, upon exercise, are issued from the Company&#8217;s unissued common shares. In August 2006, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company approved fixed pre-established quarterly grant dates for all future grants of options.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	At-The-Market Equity Offering Program
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On December 22, 2016 the Company announced that it has filed a prospectus supplement under which it may sell up to&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$20.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;of its common stock through an "at-the-market" equity offering program (the "ATM Program"). ION intends to use the net proceeds from sales under the ATM Program for general corporate purposes. The timing of any sales will depend on a variety of factors to be determined by ION. As of December 31, 2016, no shares were sold under the program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-28
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:672PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Stock Repurchase Program
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On November 4, 2015, the Company&#8217;s board of directors approved a stock repurchase program authorizing a Company stock repurchase, from time to time from November 10, 2015 through November 10, 2017, up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in shares of the Company&#8217;s outstanding common stock. The stock repurchase program may be implemented through open market repurchases or privately negotiated transactions, at management&#8217;s discretion. The actual timing, number and value of shares repurchased under the program will be determined by management at its discretion and will depend on a number of factors including the market price of the shares of our common stock and general market and economic conditions, applicable legal requirements and compliance with the terms of our outstanding indebtedness. The repurchase program does not obligate the Company to acquire any particular amount of common stock and may be modified or suspended at any time and could be terminated prior to completion. As of December 31, 2016, the Company was authorized to repurchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through November 17, 2017 and had repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	451,792
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of its common stock under the repurchase program at an average price per share of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.41
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The number of shares repurchased and the average price per repurchased share has been retroactively adjusted to reflect the one-for-fifteen reverse stock split completed on February 4, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Reverse Stock Split and Increase in Authorized Shares
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On February 1, 2016, the Company&#8217;s stockholders approved an increase in the number of authorized shares of common stock from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	200 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	400 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	13.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	26.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;retroactively adjusted to reflect the one-for-fifteen reverse stock split.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On February 4, 2016, the Company completed a one-for-fifteen reverse stock split, and the Company&#8217;s common stock began trading on a reverse-split adjusted basis on February 5, 2016. On February 5, 2016, the closing sale price for the Company&#8217;s common stock was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on the NYSE. All numbers of shares of common stock and per share common stock data in the accompanying consolidated financial statements and related notes have been retroactively adjusted to reflect this stock split for all periods presented. Unless otherwise noted, all numbers of shares of preferred stock and per share preferred stock data in the accompanying consolidated financial statements and related notes are not adjusted to reflect the stock split of our common stock.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As a result of the reverse stock split, the number of issued and outstanding shares was adjusted and the number of shares underlying outstanding stock options and the related exercise prices were adjusted. Following the effective date of the reverse stock split, the par value of the Company&#8217;s common stock remained at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.01
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, and the number of authorized shares was reduced from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	400,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	26,666,667
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, adjusted to reflect a one-for-fifteen reverse stock split. The prices and share, restricted and option figures presented in the table below have been retroactively adjusted to reflect the one-for-fifteen reverse stock split completed on February 4, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-29
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	&#32;and

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;there was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;cash received from option exercises under all share-based payment arrangements, and the Company received
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The weighted average grant date fair value for stock option awards granted during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.04
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$16.65
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$36.15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Unit Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has issued restricted stock and restricted stock units under the Company&#8217;s 2013 Long-Term Incentive Plan and other applicable plans. Restricted stock units are awards that obligate the Company to issue a specific number of shares of common stock in the future if continued service vesting requirements are met. Non-forfeitable ownership of the common stock will vest over a period as determined by the Company in its sole discretion, generally in equal annual installments over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year period. Shares of restricted stock awarded may not be sold, assigned, transferred, pledged or otherwise encumbered by the grantee during the vesting period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The status of the Company&#8217;s restricted stock and restricted stock unit awards for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the intrinsic value of restricted stock and restricted stock unit awards was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The weighted average grant date fair value for restricted stock and restricted stock unit awards granted during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.81
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$34.20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$59.70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, respectively. The total fair value of shares vested during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$2.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Effective February, 2016, the Company terminated its Employee Stock Purchase Plan (&#8220;ESPP&#8221;) that had been in place since June 2010. The ESPP allowed all eligible employees to authorize payroll deductions at a rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of base compensation (or a fixed amount per pay period) for the purchase of the Company&#8217;s common stock. Each participant was limited to purchase no more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	33
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares per offering period or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	66
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares annually.&#160;Additionally, no participant may purchase shares in any calendar year that exceeded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$10,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in fair market value based on the fair&#160;market value of the stock on the offering commencement date. The purchase price of the common stock was the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	lesser of 85% of the closing price on the first day of the applicable offering period (or most recently preceding trading day) or 85% of the closing price on the last day of the offering period
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(or most recently preceding trading day). Each offering period is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;months and commences on February&#160;1 and August&#160;1 of each year. The ESPP was considered a compensatory plan under ASC 718, and the Company recorded compensation expense of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The expense represents the estimated fair value of the look-back purchase option. The fair value was determined using the Black-Scholes option pricing model and was recognized over the purchase period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Stock Appreciation Rights Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:672PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has adopted a stock appreciation rights plan which provides for the award of stock appreciation rights (&#8220;SARs&#8221;) to directors and selected key employees and consultants. The awards under this plan are subject to the terms and conditions set forth in agreements between the Company and the holders. The exercise price per SAR is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	not to be less than one hundred percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;of the fair market value of a share of common stock on the date of grant of the SAR. The term of each SAR shall not exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	ten years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from the grant date. Upon exercise of a SAR, the holder shall receive a cash payment in an amount equal to the spread specified in the SAR agreement for which the SAR is being exercised. In no event will any shares of common stock be issued, transferred or otherwise distributed under the plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On March&#160;1, 2016, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,210,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Stock Appreciation Rights (&#8220;SARs&#8221;) awards to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;selected key employees with an exercise price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. None of these SARs were awarded to non-employee directors. The vesting of these SARs is achieved through both a market condition and a service condition. The market condition is achieved, in part or in full, in the event that during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year period beginning on the date of grant the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-day trailing volume-weighted average price of a share of common stock is (i) greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	120%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the exercise price for the first 1/3 of the awards, (ii) greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	125%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the exercise price for the second 1/3 of the awards and (iii) greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	130%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the exercise price for the final 1/3 of the awards. The exercise condition restricts the ability of the holders to exercise awards until certain service milestones have been reached such that (i) no more than 1/3 of the awards may be exercised, if vested, on and after the first anniversary of the date of grant, (ii) no more than 2/3 of the awards may be exercised, if vested, on and after the second anniversary of the date of grant and (iii) all of the awards may be exercised, if vested, on and after the third anniversary of the date of grant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to ASC 718, the stock appreciation rights are considered liability awards and as such, these amounts are accrued in the liability section of the balance sheet. The Company calculated the fair value of each SAR award on the date of grant using a Monte Carlo simulation model. The following assumptions were used:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Valuation Assumptions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company calculated the fair value of each stock option on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. The following assumptions were used for each respective period:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The computation of expected volatility during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was based on an equally weighted combination of historical volatility and market-based implied volatility. Historical volatility was calculated from historical data for a period of time approximately equal to the expected term of the option award, starting from the date of grant. Market-based implied volatility was derived from traded options on the Company&#8217;s common stock having a term of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;months. The Company&#8217;s computation of expected life in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was determined based on historical experience of similar awards, giving consideration to the contractual terms of the stock-based awards, vesting schedules and expectations of future employee behavior. The risk-free interest rate assumption is based upon the U.S. Treasury yield curve in effect at the time of grant for periods corresponding with the expected life of the option.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Stock-based Compensation Expense

</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following table summarizes stock-based compensation expense for the years ended December 31,

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	This transfer of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$17.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;of inventory to property, plant, equipment and seismic rental equipment in December 2016, relates to ocean bottom seismic equipment manufactured by the Company to be deployed in the acquisition of ocean bottom seismic data.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-33
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:6PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:6PT">
	(b)
</SUP>
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	This transfer of inventory to property, plant, equipment and seismic rental equipment relates to ocean bottom seismic equipment manufactured by the Company to be deployed in the acquisition of ocean bottom seismic data. During the twelve months ended December 31, 2015, the Company purchased approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$19.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;of property, plant, equipment and seismic rental equipment, including approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$15.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;related to the manufacture of ocean bottom seismic equipment that will be used by the Ocean Bottom Services segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_S6DD1B8FD781B5381AF605EFECD36B25B">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(13)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

	Operating Leases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On our existing OceanGeo vessel leases, our future commitments are di minimis if we do not re-charter the vessels for a future data survey.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_S4EF0A1FB36465CA0BA801224322365B0">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(14)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Acquisition of OceanGeo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Prior to 2014, the Company owned a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;ownership interest in OceanGeo B.V. (&#8220;OceanGeo&#8221;). OceanGeo specializes in seismic acquisition operations using ocean bottom cables deployed from vessels leased by OceanGeo. To further assist OceanGeo in acquiring backlog, in October 2013, the Company also agreed to loan OceanGeo additional funds for working capital, as necessary, up to a maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Prior to obtaining a controlling interest in OceanGeo, the Company advanced a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to OceanGeo.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In January 2014, the Company acquired an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	40%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in OceanGeo, through the conversion of certain outstanding amounts loaned to OceanGeo by the Company into additional equity interests of OceanGeo, bringing the Company&#8217;s total equity interest in OceanGeo to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	70%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and giving the Company control over OceanGeo. The Company began including in its results of operations, the results of OceanGeo from the date of the Company&#8217;s acquisition of a controlling interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2014, the Company acquired the remaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of OceanGeo, increasing its equity interest in OceanGeo to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company acquired OceanGeo as part of its strategy to expand the range of service offerings it can provide to oil and gas exploration and production customers and to put its Calypso
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:7PT">
	&#174;
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;ocean bottom seismic acquisition technology to work in a service model to meet the growing demand for ocean bottom seismic services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following summarized unaudited pro forma consolidated income statement information for 2014, assumes that the OceanGeo acquisition had occurred as of the beginning of the periods presented. The Company has prepared these unaudited pro forma financial results for comparative purposes only. These unaudited pro forma financial results may not be indicative of the results that would have occurred if the Company had completed the acquisition as of the beginning of the periods presented or the results that may be attained in the future. Amounts presented below are in thousands, except for the per share amounts:
</FONT>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_56"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:99.61013645224172%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="5">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:88%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:9%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ROWSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Pro forma Consolidated ION Income Statement Information (Unaudited)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ROWSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-34

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_S16CF3E5EB82C562F95DA01EFA1E6921C">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:672PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(15)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Equity Method Investments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company owns a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	49%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in a land seismic equipment business with BGP. BGP is a subsidiary of China National Petroleum Corporation (&#8220;CNPC&#8221;) and is a global geophysical services contracting company. The joint venture company, organized under the laws of the People&#8217;s Republic of China, is named INOVA Geophysical Equipment Limited (&#8220;INOVA Geophysical&#8221;). BGP owns the remaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	51%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in INOVA Geophysical. INOVA Geophysical is managed through a Board of Directors consisting of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;members appointed by BGP and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;members appointed by the Company.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At December 31, 2014, the Company fully impaired its investment in INOVA as it determined that the decline in fair value below cost basis was other-than-temporary. This impairment was the result of the land seismic market having softened significantly due to reduced E&amp;P company spending in the North American natural gas shale plays and reduced seismic activity in Russia and other regions due to lower crude oil prices. The Company recorded a charge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$30.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, impairing its equity investment in INOVA and its share of INOVA&#8217;s accumulated other comprehensive loss, reducing both balances to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Company accounts for its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	49%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in INOVA Geophysical as an equity method investment. As of December 31, 2016, the carrying value of this investment remains
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Company no longer records its equity in losses or earnings and has no obligation, implicit or explicit, to fund any expenses of INOVA Geophysical.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_SB40CEBAED9C856E4832521D0D77E40C9">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(16)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Authoritative guidance on fair value measurements defines fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value and stipulates the related disclosure requirements. The Company follows a three-level hierarchy, prioritizing and defining the types of inputs used to measure fair value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Due to their highly liquid nature, the amount of the Company&#8217;s other financial instruments, including cash and cash equivalents, accounts and unbilled receivables, short term investments, accounts payable and accrued multi-client data library royalties, represent their approximate fair value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The carrying amounts of the Company&#8217;s long-term debt as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$163.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$186.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, compared to its fair values of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$114.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$107.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The fair value of the long-term debt was calculated using Level 1 inputs, including an active market price.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_S0B711AE973075776B812F8BB51D46438">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(17)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has a 401(k) retirement savings plan, which covers substantially all employees. Employees may voluntarily contribute
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	up to 60% of their compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, as defined, to the plan. Effective June&#160;1, 2000, the Company adopted a company matching contribution to the 401(k) plan. The Company matched the employee contribution at a rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of compensation contributed to the plan. Company contributions to the plans were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$1.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$1.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(19)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Certain Relationships and Related Party Transactions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company recorded revenues from BGP of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Receivables due from BGP were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at December&#160;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. BGP owned approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	13.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the Company&#8217;s outstanding common stock as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Mr.&#160;James&#160;M. Lapeyre, Jr. is the Chairman of the Board on ION&#8217;s board of directors and a significant equity owner of Laitram, L.L.C. (Laitram), and he has served as president of Laitram and its predecessors since 1989. Laitram is a privately-owned, New Orleans-based manufacturer of food processing equipment and modular conveyor belts. Mr.&#160;Lapeyre and Laitram together owned approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the Company&#8217;s outstanding common stock as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company acquired DigiCourse, Inc., the Company&#8217;s marine positioning products business, from Laitram in 1998. In connection with that acquisition, the Company entered into a Continued Services Agreement with Laitram under which Laitram agreed to provide the Company certain bookkeeping, software, manufacturing and maintenance services. Manufacturing services consist primarily of machining of parts for the Company&#8217;s marine positioning systems. The term of this agreement expired in September 2001 but the Company continues to operate under its terms. In addition, from time to time, when the Company has requested, the legal staff of Laitram has advised the Company on certain intellectual property matters with regard to the Company&#8217;s marine positioning systems. During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company paid Laitram and its affiliates less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which consisted of less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for manufacturing services, and less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for reimbursement for costs related to providing administrative and other back-office support services in connection with the Company&#8217;s Louisiana marine operations. For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;fiscal years, the Company paid Laitram and its affiliates less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, for these services. In the opinion of the Company&#8217;s management, the terms of these services are fair and reasonable and as favorable to the Company as those that could have been obtained from unrelated third parties at the time of their performance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2013, the Company agreed to lend up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to INOVA Geophysical, and received a promissory note issued by INOVA Geophysical to the order of the Company, which was scheduled to mature on September 30, 2013. The maturity date of the promissory note was extended to December 31, 2014. The loan was made by the Company to support certain short-term working capital needs of INOVA Geophysical. The indebtedness under the note accrues interest at an annual rate equal to the London Interbank Offered Rate plus 650 basis points or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, in the event of a default. In 2013, the Company advanced the full principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to INOVA Geophysical under the promissory note. INOVA Geophysical has repaid a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;remained outstanding at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The term of the note has not been extended past December 31, 2014, when the note went into default and INOVA has advised the Company that it is not currently able to repay the outstanding amount. In December 2014, the Company wrote down the book value of this receivable to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. During the fourth quarter 2016, the Company received
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in past due rents from INOVA.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-36
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_SCCAAA9F5ADB258DE8B431782C83A16E1">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:672PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(20)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8212; In May 2014, the FASB and the International Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;IASB&#8221;) jointly issued new accounting guidance for recognition of revenue. In August 2015, the FASB issued guidance deferring the effective date to years beginning after December 15, 2017, and interim periods within those years. This new guidance replaces virtually all existing U.S. GAAP and IFRS guidance on revenue recognition. The underlying principle is that the entity will recognize revenue to depict the transfer of goods and services to customers at an amount that the entity expects to be entitled to in the exchange of goods and services. The guidance provides a five-step analysis of transactions to determine when and how revenue is recognized. Other major provisions include capitalization of certain contract costs, consideration of time value of money in the transaction price, and allowing estimates of variable consideration to be recognized before contingencies are resolved in certain circumstances. The guidance also requires enhanced disclosures regarding the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows arising from an entity&#8217;s contracts with customers.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In December 2016, the FASB issued amendments to Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 606, Revenue from Contracts with Customers. The amendments allow entities not to make quantitative disclosures about remaining performance obligations in certain cases and require entities that use any of the new or previously existing optional exemptions to expand their qualitative disclosures. It also makes additional technical corrections and improvements to the new revenue standard. The guidance will be effective with the same date and transition requirements as those in ASC 606.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	While the Company continues to evaluate the two allowed adoption methods (either the full retrospective method or the modified retrospective method) to determine which method it plans to use, the Company currently expects to use the modified retrospective method. The Company also continues to assess whether the implementation of this new guidance will have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s New Venture and Devices groups&#8217; consolidated financial position or results of operations for the periods presented. While
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the Company continues to evaluate the impact on its consolidated financial statements for all of its business segments, the Company does not currently expect the adoption of ASC 606 to have a material impact on its consolidated balance sheets or consolidated statement of operations for its Imaging Services group, Optimization Software &amp; Services group or its Ocean Bottom Services segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases (Topic 842)&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	which introduces the recognition of lease assets and lease liabilities by lessees for those leases classified as operating leases under previous guidance. The guidance will be effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2018 and interim periods within those fiscal years with early adoption permitted. The Company currently expects that the adoption of ASU 2016-002 may have a material impact related to its facility operating leases on its consolidated financial statements, and continues to evaluate the impact of vessel leases in the Company&#8217;s Ocean Bottom Services segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09,&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	"Compensation - Stock Compensation (Topic 718):&#160;Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting,"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;that will change how companies account for certain aspects of share-based payments to employees. Entities will be required to recognize the income tax effects of awards in the statement of income when the awards vest or are settled, the guidance on employers&#8217; accounting for an employee&#8217;s use of shares to satisfy the employer&#8217;s statutory income tax withholding obligation and for forfeitures is changing and the update requires companies to present excess tax benefits as an operating activity on the statement of cash flows rather than as a financing activity. The amendments in this update will be effective for annual periods beginning after&#160;December 15, 2016&#160;and interim periods within those annual periods. Early adoption is permitted. The Company will adopt ASU 2016-09 in the first quarter of 2017. The Company is unable to estimate the impact of adoption as it is dependent upon future stock option exercises which cannot be predicted, however, the Company is not expecting the adoption of ASU 2016-09 to have a material impact on net income, basic and diluted earnings per share, deferred tax assets or net cash from operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-13,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	"Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	that will change how companies measure credit losses for most financial assets and certain other instruments that aren&#8217;t measured at fair value through net income. The standard will replace today&#8217;s &#8220;incurred loss&#8221; approach with an &#8220;expected loss&#8221; model for instruments measured at amortized cost. For available-for-sale debt securities, entities will be required to record allowances rather than reduce the carrying amount. The amendments in this update will be effective for annual periods beginning after&#160;December 15, 2019&#160;and interim periods within those annual periods. Early adoption is permitted for annual periods beginning after December 15, 2018. The Company is evaluating the effect of ASU 2016-13 on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In August 2016 the FASB issued ASU 2016-15,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8220;Statement of Cash Flows (Topic 230), Classification of Certain Cash Receipts and Cash Payments (a consensus of the FASB Emerging Issues Task Force) (ASU 2016-15)&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, that clarifies how entities should classify certain cash receipts and cash payments on the statement of cash flows. The guidance also clarifies how the predominance principle should be applied when cash receipts and cash payments have aspects of more than one class of cash flows. The guidance will be effective for annual periods beginning after&#160;December 15, 2017&#160;and interim periods within those annual periods. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is evaluating the effect of ASU 2016-15 on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-37
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:672PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:6PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November 2016 the FASB issued ASU 2016-18,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8220;Statement of Cash Flows (Topic 230), Restricted Cash (a consensus of the FASB Emerging Issues Task Force) (ASU 2016-18)&#8221;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, that will require entities to show changes in the total of cash, cash equivalents, restricted cash and restricted cash equivalents in the statement of cash flows. As a result, entities will no longer present transfers between cash and cash equivalents and restricted cash and restricted cash equivalents in the statement of cash flows. When cash, cash equivalents, restricted cash and restricted cash equivalents are presented in more than one-line item on the balance sheet, a reconciliation of the totals in the statement of cash flows to the related captions in the balance sheet is required. The guidance will be effective for annual periods beginning after&#160;December 15, 2017&#160;and interim periods within those annual periods. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is evaluating the effect of ASU 2016-18 on its consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A12311610K2016_HTM_S1C7CEC28D45F530E952B1529749C58A9">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:18PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	(21)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#32;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Condensed Consolidating Financial Information
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The notes were issued by ION Geophysical Corporation, and are guaranteed by the Company&#8217;s current material U.S. subsidiaries: GX Technology Corporation, ION Exploration Products (U.S.A.), Inc. and I/O Marine Systems, Inc. (&#8220;the Guarantors&#8221;), which are 100-percent-owned subsidiaries. <FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Certification of Chief Executive Officer Pursuant to Rule 13a-14(a) or Rule 15d-14(a).
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<A NAME="IO-12312016X10KEX1039_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10"></A>
<DIV>
<A NAME="IO-12312016X10KEX1039_HTM_SA7F31C27808112B98A181F3A5605297E">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
